page.title: 04THE GOATSHEAD INN
page.content: The Goatshead was built in 1573.It used to be the village's Town Hall. It has a stable at the back and is now used as a public house.There is a legend that Dick Turpin once stayed there for a night and in the morning he went to Rugeley to steal "Black Bess". The Goatshead has a secret passage under it, which leads to the church and Manor Farm.The passage is now blocked off, but part of it is used as the cellars where the beer is kept. The building is made of a timber frame with wattle and daub infill. The present landlord keeps an aviary and a hen run in the back garden.They have 9 hens,3 pheasants and 4 quails.
